definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: The march composing in small on her home, suddenly being taken away by guards locked up in a prison.
sentences.chinese: 赛琦雅正在小玉儿家，突然被侍卫带走关进了大牢。

sentences.english: Stone cure too much XiangDongPo revealed ashmore had expected it to guard dont retype it.
sentences.chinese: 石太医向东坡透露安石已预料此事，要侍卫不要重打。

sentences.english: After a few moments the captain of the guard dismissed the soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 须臾侍卫首领便解散了那些士兵。

sentences.english: The contingent of two hundred guards and eunuchs was still there, standing stiffly to attention.
sentences.chinese: 只见一众侍卫太监仍是直挺挺的站着不动。

sentences.english: Then the captain of the guard motioned me towards the entrance of the pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 侍卫首领便示意我进那楼阁里去。

sentences.english: TheKing has ordered half the number of guards he usually puts on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 国王也把其半数侍卫军投入到城墙的防守中去了。

sentences.english: However, they just thought that he was joking.
sentences.chinese: 但侍卫们却只当他在开玩笑。

sentences.english: Then the king ordered the guards at his side: "Turn and kill the priests of the LORD, because they too have sided with David.
sentences.chinese: 王就吩咐左右的侍卫说，你们去杀耶和华的祭司。

sentences.english: The king ordered the Grand Chamberlain to bring the prisoner immediately.
sentences.chinese: 国王命令侍卫长马上把犯人带来。

sentences.english: One of them drew aside the captain of the guard, and in a low voice whispered to him.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个将侍卫首领拉到一边，低声耳语。

sentences.english: Broadsword family descendant JiZhao was xuantong emperor queen bodyguard.
sentences.chinese: 大刀世家传人齐昭曾是宣统皇帝御前侍卫。

sentences.english: If the guest does not drink, he let the guards to beauty.
sentences.chinese: 如果客人不喝酒，他就让侍卫把美人杀掉。

sentences.english: Tom tried to explain to the guards that he was a peasant boy, not the prince.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆试图向侍卫解释自己只是个乡下孩子，而非王子。

sentences.english: Suddenly, two menknocked on my door.
sentences.chinese: 突然间，有两个侍卫敲响了我家的门。

definition: defense of the imperial palace or of the capital/the palace guard (or a member of that unit)
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
(old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc
person willing to sacrifice his life (for a good cause)
